p:
This study indicated that flower oil possessed much stronger inhibitory effect compared with leaf and stem oils: the inhibition rate of flower oil on root growth of A. retroflexus was 2.96 and 3.79 times of leaf and stem oils, and on P. annua was 8.29 and 101.88 times of leaf and stem oils, respectively. Further experiment revealed that β-eudesmol (10.10%), which was a dominant compound in flower oil but not detected in leaf and stem oils, was most likely responsible for the potent phytotoxic activity of flower oil by comparing the strength of β-eudesmol and flower oil. β-eudesmol was found to possess antiangiogenic, antimutagenic, anticancer, antioxidant activity and so on, however there is no report on its phytotoxicity
21, 31– 36 .
